{{Short description|Canadian singer-songwriter and actor}} {{About|the singer|his self-titled album|Adam Gregory (album)|the actor|Adam Gregory (actor)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=August 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | image = Adam Gregory.JPG | name = Adam Gregory | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1985|7|12}} | birth_place = [[Edmonton]], Alberta, Canada | origin = | instruments = | genre = [[Country music]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter, actor | years_active = 2000–present | label = [[Epic Records|Epic]], Mensa, [[Big Machine Records|Big Machine]]/No Strings Attached/[[Midas Records Nashville|Midas]], [[Open Road Recordings|Open Road]], [[GMV Nashville]] | associated_acts = [[Billy Ray Cyrus]] | website = {{URL|www.adamgregory.com/}} }} '''Adam Gregory''' (born July 12, 1985) is a Canadian [[country music]] singer-songwriter and actor. Active since 2000, he has recorded four studio albums to date, including ''[[The Way I'm Made]]'' (2000) and ''Workin' on It'' (2002), both on [[Epic Records]], and a self-titled album in 2006 on Mensa Records. He has charted several singles on the Canadian country music charts, including two singles which were also Top 40 hits on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] chart in the United States. In 2010, Gregory starred in ''WWJD'', a film-based on ''[[In His Steps]]'' by [[Charles Sheldon]]. ==Career== ===Canadian career=== Adam Gregory launched his career in country music when his first album, ''[[The Way I'm Made]]'', was released in 2000 on [[Epic Records]]. It was certified as a [[Music recording sales certification|gold record]] by [[Music Canada]] in May 2003.[http://www.thatscountry.com/artman/publish/article_2655.shtml Adam Gregory Gets Set to Release New Album] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080911220346/http://www.thatscountry.com/artman/publish/article_2655.shtml |date=September 11, 2008 }} He won a Prairie Music Award for Outstanding Country Music Recording in 2001, and the [[Canadian Radio Music Awards|Canadian Radio Music Award]] for Best New Country Artist for his song "Horseshoes."[http://www.cowichantheatre.bc.ca/calendar_of_events/adam_gregory.htm Cowichan Theatre – Duncan, BC] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080919003151/http://www.cowichantheatre.bc.ca/calendar_of_events/adam_gregory.htm |date=September 19, 2008 }} He met [[Billy Ray Cyrus]] while performing at [[Big Valley Jamboree]] in [[Camrose, Alberta]]. Cyrus was the headliner and asked Gregory to perform with him on his hit "[[Achy Breaky Heart]]". Soon after, Cyrus was heard on "When I Leave This House".{{usurped|1=[https://archive.today/20120716120414/http://jam.canoe.ca/Music/Artists/G/Gregory_Adam/2002/07/08/745537.html CANOE – JAM! Music – Artists – Gregory, Adam: About Adam]}} The song was included on Gregory's second album, ''Workin' on It'', which was released in 2002. Gregory went to [[Kabul]], [[Afghanistan]] in 2003 for the OP ATHENA Show Tour from November 19 to December 5 to perform for the troops. Other performers included [[Dave Broadfoot]], Shaun Verrault from [[Wide Mouth Mason]], singer and dancer Jana Jana, and the Rock-Paper-Scissors Improv Comedy group.[http://www.forces.gc.ca/site/Newsroom/view_news_e.asp?id=1259 Adam Gregory Travels to Afghanistan] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081208140555/http://www.forces.gc.ca/site/Newsroom/view_news_e.asp?id=1259 |date=December 8, 2008 }} Gregory has shown his philanthropic side by being a supporter of the [[Telemiracle]][http://www.strands.ca/telemiracle/telemiracle_pics.html Telemiracle ] for many years, appearing on the show three times, holding charities for the [[Ronald McDonald House]],[http://www.teenmag.com/celeb-stuff/watch-this-face/adam-gregory Ronald McDonald ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081208124917/http://www.teenmag.com/celeb-stuff/watch-this-face/adam-gregory |date=December 8, 2008 }} and his involvement with the Sunshine Foundation, which is similar to the [[Make-a-Wish Foundation]].[http://www.sunshine.ca/involved/volunteer/spotlight/ Sunshine Foundation/Make A Wish Foundation ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081006085813/http://www.sunshine.ca/involved/volunteer/spotlight/ |date=October 6, 2008 }} Gregory also performed at [[West Edmonton Mall]] in 2005 to help raise money for the [[Canadian Red Cross]] to donate to the South Asia tsunami fund.[http://mashuganauts.blogspot.com/ Tsunami Fund] In 2002, Gregory's album ''Workin' on It'' was nominated for Album of the Year and Best Graphics at the [[Canadian Country Music Association]] awards. Gregory was also nominated in 2005 for the [[Country Music Association]]'s Global Country Artist Award.[http://www.country.com.au/index.cfm?page_id=1002&news_display_year_5069=2005&display_news_id_5069=1039 CMA Announces International Candidates for CMA Global Country Artist Award] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080722134035/http://www.country.com.au/index.cfm?page_id=1002&news_display_year_5069=2005&display_news_id_5069=1039 |date=July 22, 2008 }} In June 2006, Gregory's third album, ''Adam Gregory'', containing the single, "Get It On", was released by Mensa Records in association with [[Aquarius Records (Canada)|Aquarius Records]].[{{AllMusic|class=album|id=r838692|pure_url=yes}} allmusic ((( Adam Gregory > Overview )))] Adam Gregory has continued to further develop his career in the entertainment industry through film, taking a leading role in the comedy ''Sharp as Marbles''. In 2009, he starred in ''WWJD'' with [[John Schneider (screen actor)|John Schneider]].[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0815235/ Sharp as Marbles (2008)] Adam Gregory’s song “The World Could Use A Cowboy” was covered by Canadian Country Music Singer Ty Baynton in 2021 on his album Wrong Turns. ===U.S. crossover=== In 2007, Gregory signed an exclusive management deal and signed with longtime supporter Jeff Walker of [[AristoMedia]] for all publicity campaigns and signed with [[Midas Records Nashville]]. He has been booked by the [[William Morris Agency]] in Nashville.{{cite web|url=http://www.aristomedia.com/news.php?id=432 |title=The AristoMedia Group | Nashville, TN | PR, Video Marketing, Radio Promotion, Internet Marketing |publisher=Aristomedia.com |date=August 25, 2008 |accessdate=February 21, 2014 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140301041424/http://www.aristomedia.com/news.php?id=432 |archivedate=March 1, 2014 }} In April 2008, Gregory released his first single to the United States.[http://blogcritics.org/archives/2008/08/22/215816.php Adam Gregory Digital Release and First Opry Appearance August 26 ] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081208082806/http://blogcritics.org/archives/2008/08/22/215816.php |date=December 8, 2008 }} "[[Crazy Days (song)|Crazy Days]]" peaked at No. 33 on the [[Hot Country Songs]] chart. In July 2008, [[Midas Records Nashville]] co-signed Gregory with [[Big Machine Records]].{{Cite web |url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/content_display/industry/e3i074bfb9c1a9902f7669ccb86a4285932 |title=Midas Nashville Restructures, Gregory Finds New Home |access-date=October 2, 2008 |archive-date=December 8, 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081208052232/http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/content_display/industry/e3i074bfb9c1a9902f7669ccb86a4285932 |url-status=dead }}[http://www.aristomedia.com/news.php?id=449 Cricket Communications ((( Adam Gregory Partnership )))] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090202153812/http://www.aristomedia.com/news.php?id=449 |date=February 2, 2009 }} A new album, ''[[Crazy Days (album)|Crazy Days]]'', was released on March 24, 2009, in Canada through [[Big Machine Records|Big Machine]]/[[Midas Records Nashville|Midas]]/NSA.[http://top40-charts.com/news.php?nid=39468 Adam Gregory Makes USA Debut With New Single 'Crazy Days'] The second single from the album, "[[What It Takes (Adam Gregory song)|What It Takes]]", was released in November and peaked at No. 38 on the Hot Country Songs chart. In October 2008, [[Cricket Wireless|Cricket Communications]] partnered with [[Big Machine Records]] and Gregory for a promotional sponsorship with ringtones and in store events for the remainder of 2008.{{Cite web |url=http://www.countryhound.com/Adam-Gregory-Coming-to-Cricket-Store-Near-You |title=Country Music News Article |access-date=January 7, 2009 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090202105853/http://www.countryhound.com/Adam-Gregory-Coming-to-Cricket-Store-Near-You |archive-date=February 2, 2009 |url-status=dead }} In January 2009, Gregory became a spokesman for the charity [[Soles4Souls]] which raises money and donates shoes for the needy.[http://www.soles4souls.org/events/2009/01-19/adam-gregory-and-soles4souls-partner-for-charity-campaign-club-tour Soles4Souls] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090202003613/http://www.soles4souls.org/events/2009/01-19/adam-gregory-and-soles4souls-partner-for-charity-campaign-club-tour |date=February 2, 2009 }} In 2010, Gregory sang "What Would Jesus Do?" in the movie ''WWJD'', which is based on the book ''[[In His Steps]]'' by the late [[Charles Sheldon]].[http://wwjdmovie.com/ WWJD] Although Big Machine went on to release Gregory's ''Crazy Days'' album in conjunction with [[Open Road Recordings]] in Canada, a U.S. release never happened, and Gregory left the label to focus on his songwriting and complete a series of tour commitments in his native Canada. Since then, Gregory has focused on his songwriting and recorded a newer, more personal batch of songs. In 2012, Gregory released his first EP, ''Different Places''. It was recorded with Australian producer Mark Moffatt in 2011 and was released on [[GMV Nashville]]/Calusa Entertainment.{{cite web|url=http://www.roughstock.com/audio/adam-gregory-high-on-you/ |title=Adam Gregory – High On You | New Country Music, Songs. Listen for Free |publisher=Roughstock.com |accessdate=February 21, 2014 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140228163828/http://www.roughstock.com/audio/adam-gregory-high-on-you/ |archivedate=February 28, 2014 }} On February 13, 2013, Gregory signed with Shakir Entertainment Management in New York City. === Movie career === In 2010, Gregory appeared in ''What Would Jesus Do''.{{IMDb title|1430131|title=What Would Jesus Do}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:12em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details !
